summaryText: What an incredible message from Pastor James Braxton Powell about facing our issues head-on with God's power! Powell shared a deeply personal sermon about wrestling with life's challenges and staying close to Jesus, using the powerful story of Jairus and the woman with the issue of blood from Mark chapter 5. Can you imagine being so desperate for healing that you'd crawl through a crowd just to touch Jesus' garment? Powell reminds us that 'crawling counts in the kingdom of God' - meaning even when we feel weak, our faith can still move mountains! He vulnerably shared his own struggles, including his son being bullied and his past trauma, demonstrating that God isn't scared of our 'uncleanness'. The most powerful moment was when Powell declared that whatever the enemy has fought against you, God has a greater purpose. He challenged the church to wake up, rise up, and recognize that greater is He that is in us than he that is in the world. The sermon was a rallying cry for believers to stop living defeated and start walking in divine purpose, no matter what issues we're facing.
mainPoints: Remove pride and stay close to Jesus
Reach out in pain and touch the Healer

versesMentioned.text: For we are God's masterpiece, created in Christ Jesus to do good works, which God prepared in advance for us to do.
The thief comes only to steal and kill and destroy; I have come that they may have life, and have it to the full.
A detailed narrative about Jairus's daughter and the woman with the issue of blood, highlighting Jesus' healing power and compassion.

Monday.scripture: Isaiah 43:2: 'When you pass through the waters, I will be with you; and when you pass through the rivers, they will not sweep over you. When you walk through the fire, you will not be burned; the flames will not set you ablaze.'
Monday.focus: Recognizing God's presence in our challenges
Monday.action: Write down a current struggle you're experiencing. Spend time reflecting on how God might be present in this situation, even if you can't see a clear resolution.
Monday.prayer: Lord, help me see Your hand in my current challenges. Give me eyes to recognize Your work, even when circumstances feel overwhelming. Teach me to trust Your process. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: James 1:2-4: 'Consider it pure joy, my brothers and sisters, whenever you face trials of many kinds, because you know that the testing of your faith produces perseverance. Let perseverance finish its work so that you may be mature and complete, not lacking anything.'
Tuesday.focus: Understanding the purpose of our struggles
Tuesday.action: Identify one personal growth area that has emerged from a past difficult season. Journal about how that challenge ultimately made you stronger spiritually.
Tuesday.prayer: God, transform my perspective on challenges. Help me see trials as opportunities for spiritual growth rather than obstacles. Give me wisdom to learn and grow through every season. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Romans 8:28: 'And we know that in all things God works for the good of those who love him, who have been called according to his purpose.'
Wednesday.action: Make a list of current challenges. Next to each, write a potential way God might be working for good, even if you can't see it yet.
Wednesday.prayer: Heavenly Father, I trust that You are working, even when I cannot understand. Help me surrender my limited perspective and trust Your greater plan. Give me faith to believe You are transforming my challenges. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Psalm 34:18: 'The Lord is close to the brokenhearted and saves those who are crushed in spirit.'
Thursday.action: Reach out to someone you know is going through a difficult season. Offer genuine encouragement, prayer, and support without trying to fix their situation.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, make me an instrument of Your comfort. Help me be present for others who are hurting, showing them Your love and compassion. Use me to demonstrate Your nearness. Amen.

Friday.scripture: 2 Corinthians 4:8-9: 'We are hard pressed on every side, but not crushed; perplexed, but not in despair; persecuted, but not abandoned; struck down, but not destroyed.'
Friday.action: Create a personal 'testimony wall' - write down past challenges you've overcome, creating a visual reminder of God's faithfulness.
Friday.prayer: God, remind me of Your faithfulness. When I feel overwhelmed, help me remember how You've carried me through past trials. Renew my hope and strengthen my spirit. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Philippians 1:6: 'Being confident of this, that he who began a good work in you will carry it on to completion until the day of Christ Jesus.'
Saturday.focus: Trusting God's ongoing work in our lives
Saturday.action: Spend time in quiet reflection. Ask God to reveal areas where He is currently refining and developing you. Listen quietly and journal any insights.
Saturday.prayer: Lord, I trust Your process of transformation. Continue Your work in me. Reveal the areas where I need growth, and give me the courage to surrender to Your perfect plan. Amen.
